name: Ohio Athletic Conference 2004 Online Trivia | Sports | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many teams are in the OAC?
questions.explanation:
Ten.

	There were 10 teams in the OAC including: Baldwin-WallaceYellow Jackets, Capital Crusaders, Heidelberg Student Princes, John Carroll Blue Streaks, Marietta Pioneers, Mount Union Purple Raiders, Muskingum Fighting Muskies, Ohio Northern Polar Bears, Otterbein Cardinals, and Wilmington Quakers.

questions.text: How many teams competed in Wrestling, in the OAC during the 2003-04 season?
questions.explanation:
Seven.

	John Carroll, Ohio Northern, Heidelberg, Wilmington, Baldwin-Wallace, Mount Union, and Muskingum, were the seven teams that competed in wrestling.

questions.text: How many different sports were competed in, in OAC play?
questions.explanation:
14.

	There were 14 different sports that competed in the OAC. Some sports like Cross Country are played by both Men and Women's teams.

questions.text: Which team won the OAC Women's Golf Championship in 2004?
questions.explanation:
Otterbein & Otterben & Otterbien.

	Otterbein had three athletes finish in the top 10 in the championships.

questions.text: Which school had the OAC Defensive Player of the Week for three consecutive weeks to start the 2004 Football season?
questions.explanation:
Ohio Northern.

	Three different players won the award for the Polar Bears. Jason Trusnik, Aaron Esposito, and Wes Hostettler, all won the award.

questions.text: Who won the regular season baseball championship in 2003-2004?
questions.explanation:
Marietta.

	Marietta won the regular season, while Heidelberg won the tournament.

questions.text: What school won the all-sports Men's championship for the 2003-04 school year?
questions.explanation:
John-Caroll.

	The John-Carroll men won the OAC all-sports trophy winning four team championships on the year.

questions.text: What school won the all-sports Womens championship for the 2003-04 school year?
questions.explanation:
Baldwin-Wallace.

	The John-Carroll wommen won the OAC all-sports trophy winning only two team championships on the year.  It was their 11th all-sports title.

questions.text: When was the OAC Centennial Celebration?
questions.explanation:
2002.

	The OAC predates even the NCAA. The OAC was the third oldest conference in college sports history in 2004. Only the Michigan Intercollegiate Athletic Association (1888) and Big Ten (1894) predated the Ohio Athletic Conference.

questions.text: Who won the Clyde A. Lamb award for women at ONU in 2004?
questions.explanation:
Ashley Dally.

	All four ladies won the award in 2004, only Dally attended ONU though. Lamb was a teacher and coach at ONU from 1926-1964, and he also organized the Department of Health and Physical Education.
